Class GhostBrickHandler

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.ui.GhostBrickHandler
public class GhostBrickHandler extends Object
Renders and positions a translucent ghost brick indicating the landing position of the active brick, supporting upside-down mode.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Eashwar

  • Constructor Details

    • GhostBrickHandler

      public GhostBrickHandler(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gamePanel, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane brickPanel, javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty gamePanelSceneX, javafx.beans.property.DoubleProperty gamePanelSceneY, GameRenderer renderer)
      Constructs the ghost handler with references to panels and renderer.
      Parameters:
      gamePanel - main board panel
      brickPanel - active brick panel
      gamePanelSceneX - bound scene X for positioning
      gamePanelSceneY - bound scene Y for positioning
      renderer - renderer used for colors and row mapping

  • Method Details

    • setUpsideDown

      public void setUpsideDown(boolean value)
      Enables or disables upside-down mode.
      Parameters:
      value - whether upside-down mode is active

    • init

      public void init(ViewData brick)
      Initializes ghost rectangles according to the active brick size.
      Parameters:
      brick - current view data

    • update

      public void update(ViewData brick, int[][] boardMatrix)
      Updates the ghost colors and positions the panel at the landing spot.
      Parameters:
      brick - current view data
      boardMatrix - background matrix

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Hides the ghost panel.

    • positionGhostPanel

      private void positionGhostPanel(int xCurrent, int yCurrent, int yFinal)
      Positions the ghost panel relative to the brick panel.
      Parameters:
      xCurrent - current x-position
      yCurrent - current y-position
      yFinal - landing y-position
